content.raw:
If I do:

~~~
catkin_make
. devel/setup.bash
catkin_make run_tests_servicesim_test
~~~

Gazebo fails to find the plugin:

`[Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libTrajectoryActorPlugin.so: libTrajectoryActorPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`

If I do:

~~~
catkin_make install
. install/setup.bash
catkin_make install run_tests_servicesim_test
~~~

ROS fails to find the test node:

`FAILURE: Test node [servicesim_test/trajectory_actor_plugin-test] does not exist or is not executable`

What's the winning combination for you?
content.html:
If I do:

catkin_make
. devel/setup.bash
catkin_make run_tests_servicesim_test

Gazebo fails to find the plugin:

[Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libTrajectoryActorPlugin.so: libTrajectoryActorPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

If I do:

catkin_make install

content.raw:
Thanks for the help IRL! I managed to make it work, for future reference:

~~~
catkin_make_isolated --catkin-make-args install
catkin_make_isolated --catkin-make-args install run_tests
~~~

I just ran the test 5 times and it always passed, but we need to revisit this later to see why it fails for you. 

I do get an assertion failure:

~~~
trajectory_actor_plugin-test: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:113: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.
~~~

But the test still passes, I think this might be when tearing down Gazebo stuff in the test.

catkin_make_isolated --catkin-make-args install
